author: {'steamid': '76561197989923734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 379, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1712273461}
review:
Трудно писать отзыв на такое и избежать спойлеров. Так что, если что, я предупредил.

Довольно странный сюжет, две сумасшедшие глупые девочки, склонные к ЛГБТ, неделю на курорте вместо отдыха морально насилуют и физически бьют ГГ по голове (в наличии как минимум одно сотрясение мозга и один ушиб мозга лёгкой степени, с нарушением сознания на несколько часов, в течение которых, к тому же, сумасшедшие таскают ГГ без сознания из номера на пляж). В итоге, вместо того чтобы хотя бы держаться от них подальше или вызвать полицию, ГГ начинает с одной или сразу с обоими романтические отношения (при том, что довольно быстро по сюжету становится ясно, что обоим сумасшедшим ГГ нравится, но ГГ никогда ничего такого про них не думал). Можно почитать, чтобы знать как делать не надо или если есть склонность к садизму (для девочек) или мазохизму (для мальчиков).

author: {'steamid': '76561198306649403', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 41286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32817, 'last_played': 1709169635}
review:
À Deus, que me guiou nos momentos mais difíceis e me deu os dons sem os
quais a realização deste trabalho seria impossível.
À minha mãe e meu padrasto, que forneceram a base de meu ser.
Ao meu avô, Odilon, e minha avó, Inês (in memoriam) que em nenhum
momento de minha vida abriram mão de minha educação e de meu bem.
Ao Victor, meu irmão, por fazer com que eu procure sempre ser uma pessoa
melhor e um dos responsáveis por meu interesse por este tema.
À Renata, minha “namorida”, que me aguentou e confortou nos momentos de
mais puro estresse e ainda deu inúmeras contribuições para o fechamento deste
trabalho. Que acreditou em mim até quando eu não acreditava.
Aos meus familiares, em especial Neyse e Mario, Nicollas e Lucas, que deram
imenso suporte ao longo de minha vida, em especial acadêmica.
Ao meu sogro Nilton e minha sogra Eliane, por me fornecer suporte nos
momentos difíceis e me aturar.
À Christianne Luce Gomes, a Chris, a responsável pela "picada" do Lazer em
mim, um exemplo de pessoa.
Ao Rafael Fortes, pelas inúmeras e valorosas orientações e por sua confiança
em meu trabalho.
Aos amigos por apoiarem minhas decisões e rirem junto comigo de meus
erros.
Aos competentes Danilo e Cinira do colegiado, que sanaram as dúvidas mais
cabeludas que um ser humano possa ter.
Aos membros da banca e da qualificação que fizeram com que eu pudesse
extrair o máximo de meu trabalho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038344006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1704993615}
review: I don't know why did this game become the subject of so much trolling; it's just a simple and mediocre dime-a-dozen VN. A guy in his late teens and two of his female friends go on a seaside holiday; both girls have a crush on the guy, and are battling for his attention and love, but he is socially awkward and needs some time and help to get the message. Sounds cute? Yeah, it is a nice premise, but unfortunately it is marred by poor writing and tired anime tropes. The plot consists of the girls repeatedly calling the guy a fool and an idiot, then forcing him into awkward situations, then calling him a perverted fool and idiot, occasionally assaulting him. Maybe this is considered amusing in some cultures, but for me it was cringe and abusive. The ending is sweet, but does not redeem the game. On the positive side, the art is beautiful.

review: Sakura Beach is often described as the quintessential visual novel. And for all its merits, it's not a half bad game. But it is absolutely not the crazy degenerate game people like to paint it as. There are some raunchy screencaps, but there is NOT anything too out of the ordinary in terms of lewdness. If you want the most bang for your buck, go buy Koikatsu Party.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132663582', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1577289692}
review:
Sakura Beach offers a delightful virtual escape to the sun-soaked shores and gentle waves of a serene beach setting, right from the comfort of your own home. This visual novel game has truly won my heart with its captivating storyline, charming characters, and tranquil atmosphere.

From the moment I launched Sakura Beach, I was immediately drawn into a world of pure relaxation. The beautifully illustrated beach backdrop, accompanied by the soothing sound of the waves, instantly transported me to a place of tranquility and peace. It's the perfect game for unwinding after a long day, or simply to take a break from the hustle and bustle of life.

But what truly sets Sakura Beach apart is its engaging story and well-crafted characters. The protagonists' personalities are endearing and relatable, making it easy to connect with their experiences and emotions. The interactions between the characters are heartwarming and sometimes even humorous, creating a perfect balance between heartfelt moments and light-hearted banter.

The decision-making aspect of the game adds an exciting layer of interactivity. Your choices influence the course of the story, allowing for multiple playthroughs to explore different outcomes. This adds replay value and encourages players to immerse themselves even more deeply into the game's universe.

The game's art style is a true visual treat. The character designs are beautifully detailed, and the beach scenes are a feast for the eyes. The attention to detail in both the character animations and the backgrounds is a testament to the developers' dedication to creating a high-quality experience.

Sakura Beach's soundtrack is a masterpiece in itself. The gentle melodies perfectly complement the laid-back atmosphere of the game, enhancing the overall immersion. The combination of visuals, sound, and storytelling creates an enchanting synergy that truly captures the essence of a peaceful beach vacation.

In conclusion, Sakura Beach offers a wonderful opportunity to escape to a serene coastal paradise without leaving your home. Its engaging storyline, charming characters, and relaxing ambiance make it a must-play for anyone seeking a tranquil gaming experience. So grab your virtual sunscreen and dive into the heartwarming world of Sakura Beach – you won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015483969', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1690752197}
review:
800 положительных отзывов. Как же не требовательны игроки.
Что имеем:
Скудный набор спрайтов, нарисовано добротно в общем и целом, но мало, очень мало. На протяжении чтения перед вами будет просто картинка без анимаций. даже в дешёвых новеллах больше труда и качества вложено. 
Музыка плоха, её мало - это раз, композитор её писавших, музыку писать не должен, он это не умеет.
Сюжет очень слаб и примитивен. Чел с двумя тёлками прилетает-приезжает-приходит (это нам не известно. а возможно и живёт неподалёку) на отдых и тусуется с ними у моря. Само собой он тугодум и не понимает намёков.  Читать такое скучно, тупо неинтересно. Длительность  истории для новеллы очень короткая. Ситуации избито простые.
Может это порно-новелла и тут будут смачные картинки сочных тянок - тоже нет,  Максимум типа слитающий лифчик  не оголяющий находящегося под ним. Просто две тянки в одном виде купальников.
Я и половины новелл под тайтлом Сакуры не читал,  но это крайне низкого качества. После такой желания покупать вторую часть ещё меньше. Сюжеты в бесплатных VN увлекательней и грамотней написаны.

we need chinese, Ach and cloud save. 差评呼吁中文，成就和云存档，个人也不推荐靠色做卖点的游戏。

202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198376856986', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1683324825}
review:
How to make crack cocaine

1: Mix cocaine and baking soda at a 4:1 ratio (4 parts cocaine to one part baking soda). Make sure they are chopped into fine powder and mixed well, then combine them into the glass container.

2: Add a few drops of water until the mixed powder becomes like thin mud.

3: Heat the bottom of the container, evenly, until the entire mixture begins to boil.

4: Once the mix starts to boil, remove from heat and let the mixture cool. After cooling, it should be a mass of hardened crack that still has bubbles of air-pockets in it from boiling.

5: Remove the air bubbles. To remove the bubble air-pockets in the crack rock, simply add more water into the glass container and reheat the mixture until you have a solid yellow crack-blob floating in the water.

6: Let the water and crack-blob cool, then remove the hardened mass.

7: Your crack is now ready to be packaged and sold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249949320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1683251796}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561198087475339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1671724796}
review:
This is probably one of the worst written pieces of media I've ever had to endure, and what makes it even more painful is that I actually bought it with real money. Like I worked a real life job, to get a real life paycheque, only to completely fucking waste it on this absolutely terrible VN. Calling the writing atrocious is an understatement, the plot is so mind-numbingly boring, with 1 dimensional characters and an MC I'd give my left ball to punch. It's just trope, after trope, after trope. The music is annoying and repetitive, the sprites are limited in quantity, and there's not even any nudity or anything that might make you consider picking it up - even if it was just for a wank. I honestly thought this game had a cheap chinese translation before finding out it was written in english originally, which doesn't even make me angry, it just makes me really sad. 

There was 1 good scene, and that was when [spoiler] they just kissed randomly out of nowhere [/spoiler]. Honestly, it wasn't even that good of a scene I think I was just fucking delirious at that point with how many of my braincells the game had taken from me. I cannot stress enough, please don't buy or play this game. It is horrible. The only reason I sat through this bullshit is because I bought a humblebundle god knows how many years ago with a bunch of these sakura games in them, and I've been trying to clear my backlog. This was the first one I played, and at this point I'll probably play the rest of them as a form of self harm.

This game is psychological torture. It's not even bad in a 'this is so bad it's good way', or 'haha lets play a sakura game in a discord call with the boys', it's just so boring that it causes physical pain in your body. If you were considering buying this game, just withdraw the money from your bank and give it to a homeless guy to spend on crack. The thought of that homeless guy getting shitfaced on your dime will bring you infinitely more entertainment than this game could ever provide

author: {'steamid': '76561198043654979', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1671353236}
review:
I'm only recommending this because of the twist halfway through recontextualizing what we were seeing up to that point was effective, Momoko was cute, and some of the erotic scenes ([spoiler]popsicle[/spoiler] were amusing.

THAT SAID, my god was this one irritating. First (lasting) impressions: I'm gonna say I'm pretty sick of casual domestic violence and comic concussions, but most importantly: protagonists who do nothing to protect themselves. You opened the door at the wrong time? Turn around, close the door, the incessant lampshading that somehow gained universality in ecchi has long since gotten tedious and this trope needs to die.

You know the drill, protag knocks, enters, goes "ba-wuh, no, I, uhh, it's not what it looks like, let me keep stammering here for the next two, ten, twenty minutes continuing to stare at you with an increasingly thin veneer of plausible deniability," Enough, alright! I've had it! How many times, Japan?! How many more times are you going to regurgitate this same scene!?!!

In general, however, it was the tonal whiplash that was the most consistent killer, "I'm depressed, ba-wuh!? Ba-ba-boobies!? And now another concussion!? I'm back on the beach now! My friends are here and they want to swim, or maybe they want to berate me. ICE CREAM!" I'm really worred about Saegi's physical ability to form new memories after a certain point, but more importantly I wish they had just done more fun beach things to allow a more natural progression for the dialogue and to actually deliver on the premise of the story but it seems like even the writer was struggling to think of what to do at the beach.

Finally: I knew I was getting a casual erotic novel when I bought it but... jeez, does casual have to mean stupid? I'll forgive the stupidities of young love, but how many times do we actually need to rehash the same misunderstandings? How about some new dumb things to misunderstand? The ending is just them being in pain and betting it all on one final contrived plan of utterly ignoring basic communication skills. "Figure it out, Saeji, go the place that shows you care about us and can hear our hearts!" What? The cliff, the field, the pool, the ocean where we keep trying to drown Ayumi? Oh, of course, the place where you said you don't care about my interests. Luckily the protagonist guesses his way to victory and finally gets to hear the two girls state the blindingly obvious-- Like I said, irritating.

Do I even need to mention how often they lie to him and then convince him it's his fault for not understanding? I guess the idea is "if you figure it out with words then you're a jerk so shut up."

... I bought three more of these games...

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1671323086}
review: Sakura Beach est un jeu narratif de la grande série des jeux "Sakura". Les graphismes sont réussis et flattent la plastique des deux protagonistes du jeu de l'histoire. Ici l'aventure se déroule à la plage comme le titre le laisse supposer et donne lieux à quelques situation cocasses. Au final une petite histoire à lire en anglais agrémentée par des images réussies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077527825', 'num_games_owned': 1981, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1652612949}
review:
Having skipped Sakura Fantasy for now, this is only my 3rd Sakura VN, and I'm only about an hour in at this point, but so far it seems pretty standard for Winged Cloud VNs. The plot is decent enough (even if the dialogue is pretty terrible at times, and the '...', '.....' transitions are annoying af), the art is pretty good (especially since they've dropped the 'shiny skin' effect from Spirit and Angels), and the music is innocuous enough. WC are still among the better VN devs I've encountered, though, and so far this isn't something I'mm regretting buying, especially while it was 75% off

UPDATE: I still don't regret buying this at the price I got it, but it's starting to look like something I wouldn't go through again. Mainly because Ayumi isn't just a tsundere, she's a F U C K E N  P S Y C H O P A T H! Bish is VIOLENT! Until now, I was under the impression that a tsundere was supposed to be 'angry' and such, not not actually murderous?

author: {'steamid': '76561198119636366', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 2749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2630, 'last_played': 1651214883}
review:
Sakura Beach is one of the most games, if not the most media of all time. Right up there, along side Morbius, Ex-Arm and Anthem.

First of all, the gun play in this game is absolutely mind-blowing and phenomenal, so far the most fun I've ever had in a first person shooter. The vast variety of loot is stellar, allowing for thousands of hours to be received.
The story is immaculate, rivalling such stories such as Borderlands 3 and Minions: Rise of Gru. I do not need to elaborate further.

Overall, just nearly the perfect game. Grab it if you can.

review: Sakura Beach is a surprisingly solid visual novel. I went in expecting a lot of memes but some of the moments will stick with me for some time to come. The story pacing is good, appropriately changing between humor and serious dialogue. Underneath the fan service, it touches on some wonderful themes: cherishing the small moments with your loved ones, why we pursue our dreams, and that the people who matter will love you despite how little you think of yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135355069', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1643401333}
review: Dieses Spiel ist eines meiner absoluten Lieblinge. Ich habe dieses Spiel bereits mehrfach durchgespielt und es erfreut mich jedes mal aufs Neue. Ich kann dieses Spiel jedem, der die Offenbarung erleben möchte, dringlichst weiterempfehlen. Die 10 Euro lohnen sich ein Leben lang. Das beste an dem Spiel ist, dass es sogar einen 2. Teil gibt, der den Spielspaß noch einmal um ein Vielfaches anhebt. Es ist einfach nur schön den leicht bekleideten Figuren auf ihrem Lebensweg zu folgen. Außerdem fühlt man sich, als wäre man selbst Teil des Spiels, was das eigene Spielerlebnis deutlich aufwertet. Negative Punkte kann man, nicht nur aus meiner subjektiven Meinung, sondern auch objektiv betrachtet, überhaupt nicht anbringen. Kauft dieses Spiel unbedingt um die Entwickler zu unterstützen, damit es vielleicht noch ein Teil 3 der perfekt ausbalancierten Reihe Sakura Beach geben wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352649875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 49328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16183, 'last_played': 1663522713}
review: This is not some kind of complex story or an innovative visual novel, rather your cliche harem love triangle with your routes of your favorite girl. Containing the rules that most VN's (Visual Novels) go by, your choices of course matter and they dictate exactly who you are friendly with, who you end up with, or even the settings of the VN. Despite it being cliche, I feel a sort of zen just relaxing to the music and the ambiance of the game, it has my favorite OST by far. Hearing the soothing waves continuously crash upon the tide while you interact with Ayumi and/or Momoko (the 2 main girls). This is not just for the horny, its a different experience for the pairing that this game has. This game could be for anyone, if you're willing to relax to anime girls in bikinis with the sounds of waves continuously crashing, as you dive into the cliche harem plot that it has to offer. For those looking for an innovative story this is not the best game to come to, as you WILL see a repetition of common set situations that you see in popular romance, ecchi, and harem anime/manga or VN's following those genres in general. Thank you for giving me your time with my crappy sentence structure and the structure of this whole review in general! I did this on whim, hope you found this helpful! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1637607484}
review:
Sakura Beach was the fifth of a series of [strike]regrettable[/strike] adult VN released here on Steam. You play as GenericProtagonist#1 who goes out on holiday with two childhood friends.

The plot is not terrible because [i]there is no plot[/i]. It is literally three people hanging out. It is linear, with few choices here and there which influence which ending you get. Characters are bland and boring, ecchi scenes come from nowhere and are uninteresting as well. The art is good, voice acting is okay too, but the exchanges are very dumb even for an ecchi VN. The art is quite good, but I don't think it makes for the flaws.

Linux port is perfect (Renpy), cards=yes, achievements=no. There are 15 CGs but no H-patch. If absolutely must, get this from a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198929225904', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1691331047}
review:
Beforehand, the game is incredible and I personally think that the devs expanded the "Sakura"-series
with another great game. Sakura Beach is a visual novel dating sim which takes place on the beach.
You, the player, slip into the role of Seiji, a dreamy boy, who spends too much time thinking about space. While being on a vacation with Ayumi and Momoko, the two girls interact with you and you can have fun with them through the conversation you have with the girls.

Compared to other classics such as Sakura Spirit, Sakura Angels and Sakura Fantasy, the game does pretty well. This time the team was working together with the artist Inma to create for us the best and most gorgeous art you will ever find in a game, and it show off. The graphics are incredible, especially Ayumi´s ass.

In this review, I won´t dive too deep into the characters, their goals and their development throughout this fascinating adventure, because this could ruin your experience and I really want you to experience
this whole masterpiece on your own.
The only thing I can say is that Momoko, despite her kind-heartedness towards Seiji and Ayumi, is a bitch with nice unga bungas. 
About Ayumi, there is a lot to say. She is a girl, who is very interested in Seiji and due to her love for him, she is pretty jealous and therefore has a thicc ass.

The game has its highs and lows, whereas you can get away with the lows due to Ayumi´s ass.

Gameplay-wise the game could be more action-packed. The dialogues are stunning and near to real-life conversations, but with not much variation the game gets reiterative after time. Some extra gamemode could have made the game more versatile, for example a fighting part, where Ayumi and Momoko fight each other. Such little and not out of nowhere gamemodes alone would help this game be more versatile and more action-packed.
Thankfully, the reiterative conversations are helped by the number of dialogue options the game gives you and the number of ways, the story can develop through your choices. You have storylines where you and Ayumi get together, Momoko gets your girlfriend or where you slaughter these bitches in a brutal way, if I would try to describe it, the FBI and Interpol would be after me (still pretty amusing).

The story, its conversations and the development the characters experience throughout the story combined with art, that is far beyond something I´ve seen ever before, I would call this game an all-time classic everyone should play at one point in his life.
This game is a masterpiece and a great example of what the gaming industry should head to in the future.

I hope you found my review of this game adjuvant and proceed to buy this game if my review aroused your interest.
This is my most anticipated review yet (with my review about "Anno Mutationem" coming close to it. You should read it if you are interested in this game. In this review I break the game down into its most important aspects and rate them, with an overall evaluation at the end)

author: {'steamid': '76561198371146130', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 11381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1633363037}
review:
[h1][b] For lazy people [/b]

I really like this game. I found out about the game form Jschlatt. If you enjoy visual novels then i think you might enjoy this one too. aight i'm off to get 1k hours in this game!!!

[h1][b] For people who like to read [/b]

This game is soo much more than just a game. Like i mentioned before i found the game form Jschlatt who had 110 hours in it and that got me intrested so i bought it fot the memes the same day and decided to try it out but i wasn't hoping anything out of it since i really haven't ever been into visual novel type games, but this game changed that. It took me in and didn't let me go, it changed me on a personal level that i didn't know existed.

[h2][b] Graphics [/b][/h2]

The graphics are good since it's a visual novel you know... All the characters, scenery everything is rich and vibrant in color and it all complements the story perfectly.

[h2][b] Soundtrack  [/b][/h2]

The soundtrack just adds on to all the stuff i talked about in the graphics part. It takes all that and enhances and improves it.  Even though the music is really loud and after a long time can get slightly annoying there is an option where you can disable it and just play with the background sounds that every scene has.

[h2][b] Conclusion [/b][/h2] 

After having spent over 99 hours in the game i can say with confidence that if you are a stupid child like me you will enjoy it. You might also enjoy it if you are not a stupid child but i highly doubt that.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070809383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1631367666}
review:
So, let me start off by saying there is nothing wrong with this game in a literal sense.  It delivers what it promises.  But, that is basically the reason I can't recommend it: it only delivers the minimum that it promises. Nothing more.

There are opportunities in this story to be so much more than it is.  There is a big theme for the main character that is treated as nothing more than a speed bump.  Something that the other characters refer to, but don't really talk about.  The only insight we get into this is from the main character, and even their internal thoughts don't really reveal all of the facts until way late in the story.

There are only six choices in the game, those choices lead to one of three endings.  The most unrealistic ending feels like the true ending, although others might actually debate that.  There should have been a fourth route - a truly bad ending.

There should have been more choices - choices that would have affected the relationship between the Seiji and each of the girls.  There could have been a lot more choices that could have defined a lot more about the personalities of each of the characters, given them more depth.

As it is, the characters are relatively flat (even if the artwork suggests otherwise for the girls).

author: {'steamid': '76561198045336457', 'num_games_owned': 1187, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1502642250}
review:
Sakura Beach es quinto título de la serie Sakura de Winged Cloud que se estrenó en agosto de 2015. Es lo que denominaríamos una novela visual de tipo conversacional de temática ánime (japonés).
Lo primero que quiero dejar claro es que el juego no tiene contenido hentai, ni existe parches –como en otros juegos-  para hacerlo para adultos.

Manejaremos a un chico llamado Seiji, que ha sido invitado a pasar un tiempo en un resort junto a la playa con sus dos amigos de la infancia, Ayumi y Momoko. Ambas chicas están interesadas en él románticamente, pero Seiji nunca se había dado cuenta de ninguna de ellas de esa manera antes. En el transcurso de esta novela visual, Seiji se enfrentará a múltiples encuentros cómicos con Ayumi y Momoko antes de enfrentarse de frente a que una o ambos pueden tener sentimientos por él.
La historia y la trama están escritas como una comedia romántica con una dosis de humor y servicio al público. Ocurrirán eventos mundanos como los intentos de Seiji de enseñar a una de las niñas a nadar, ir a mirar las estrellas y ver como las chicas cocinan juntas. Es una trama típica  a la de una " Slice of Life" sin que suceda nada significativo y en gran parte sin drama, aparte de las dos chicas que se pelean por su enamoramiento compartido por Seiji. El juego da una sensación sorprendentemente genuina, como si pudieras creer que esto podría estar sucediendo en la vida real y hace que la experiencia sea mejor. Incluso te hace desear que sea a ti al que le ocurre la historia.

La duración del juego es bastante corto, entre 4 y 6 horas. Eso sí, todo depende de lo que tardes en leer los diálogos. Tiene una opción de paso automático a gran velocidad que puede hacer reducir el juego a menos de media hora, solo tienes que elegir las opciones de diálogo. No lo recomiendo, ya que pierdes toda la esencia del juego.
Con todo esto, la novela visual corre el riesgo de simplemente volverse aburrida, sobre todo si no te involucras en la historia.
Las chicas tienen personalidades diferentes entre sí, pero en realidad no están desarrolladas más allá de sus tópicos. Tienes a Ayumi, la chica reservada que esconde su atracción detrás de un exterior más amargo; y Momoko, la chica despreocupada que tiene un pequeño toque travieso. No hay mucho más en ellos, pero tampoco es necesario que lo haya por el bien de la trama, cumplen su propósito y es probable que elijas a un personaje favorito muy rápidamente al poco de comenzar. Algo que me sorprendió es que Seiji está mucho más desarrollado, algo que es raro en este tipo de novelas gráficas en los que la mayoría de las veces el protagonista simplemente está de observador. Nunca llegas a ver a Seiji, pero al menos su personalidad tiene algo de presencia.

Como buena novela gráfica el tema visual es bastante bueno. Un buen estilo manga con gran detalle y buenos fondos (cuando se muestran), hay algo más de cambios  de escenarios que otros juegos parecidos, aunque tampoco demasiados. La banda sonora también está bastante bien, no se puede decir que sea una obra maestra pero cumple con su cometido.
Personalmente el tema de los diálogos están bastante bien, hay algunas frases filosóficas profundas y giros que te sorprenderán. Me gustaría que hubiera más opciones de diálogo (de las que puedes elegir) y las reacciones depende de lo que elijas tampoco influyen mucho.

Hay tres posibles finales diferentes por lo que hace que si te ha gustado te puedas pasar el juego tres veces, aunque personalmente creo que tampoco hay mucha diferencia entre uno y otro.
Un buen detalle del juego es que una vez que te lo has pasado hay una opción de “galería” para ver las mejores imágenes del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198451435228', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4537, 'last_played': 1642532896}
review:
This might just be one of the greatest games I have ever played to date, some will disagree and say that games like Zelda and GTA are better, I have to disagree. This game really gets you to know the characters and the plot is so great. The clashing personalities of the 2 main characters really shows you how diverse this games world building is and how the creators clearly put so much heart and soul into this game. The entire franchise has 100% changed my life for the better, it completely changed my outlook on life and how I percieve others, it now only shows but proves that you cant judge a book by its cover. The game mechanics are simple and the choice system really affects your relationship with the girls and it goes to show that sometimes you need to think before you say, in some way you could say that this game is a puzzle games as neart the end you will be confronted by the 2 girls and you will have to choose one to win your heart and further develops your realtionship with these fantastic characters. The soundtrack is also fantastic, an upbeat themed melody that really refelects the gameplay.
overall i rate this game 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198319223099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1628804196}
review:
Mundane summer read with couple surprisingly heartfelt moments.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Ambiance sound effects
+ Beautiful and clean background art
+ Working skip function and easy to rewind a bit

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Absence of choices
- Repetitive, irritating music

[b]Final verdict:[/b] ☆☆☆★★★★★★★ 
7/10 - Fine

You play as a guy called Seiji, who has gone on a nice beach holiday with two longtime friends, Ayumi and Momoko. Both girls are interested in him romantically but Seiji has never noticed either of them that way before, and the plot of the visual novel aims to change that. 

The setting promises that both girls are prominently featured in their bikinis throughout the visual novel, but you don’t get anything raunchier than that. The plot consists of mundane events such as Seiji’s attempts to teach one of the girl’s how to swim, going stargazing, and the girls cooking together. It’s very much ‘slice of life’ kind of plot with nothing significant happening and largely void of drama, apart from the two girls bickering over their shared crush on Seiji. A lot of it has surprisingly genuine feel to it, like you could believe this could be happening in real life and it makes the experience better.

With everything being so mundane the visual novel runs the risk of simply becoming boring. The length of it (just short of 4 hours for me) helps with that, it didn’t take too much out of you even if you aren’t terribly invested in the story. The girls have differing personalities to each other but aren’t really fleshed out beyond their tropes. You have Ayumi, the reserved girl who hides her attraction behind a more sour exterior; and Momoko, the carefree girl who has a minor mischievous strike to her. There isn’t much more to them but you don’t necessarily need there to be, for the sake of the plot they serve their purpose and you will likely pick a favorite very quickly after starting. Surprisingly Seiji is much more explored, which I found to be refreshing since many VN protagonists are simply blank. You never get to see Seiji, but at least his personality has some presence.

I found this to be just quite decent enough VN with pretty art. The plot was fine and the length was perfect for it. I was specially surprised over some genuine heartfelt messages the visual novel brought up, about isolation and living in the moment, so there was definitely a little more here than what it looked like from the surface. 

On the cons I noted the absence of choices, which honestly is mostly nitpicking from my side. There were six  choices throughout even though there were several scenes where it seemed like you would be getting an option to pick a line of dialogue or a reaction. The choices that did exist were all straightforward, aimed at letting you pick between the girls and each very obvious on which side you would be leaning by picking them – you won’t be surprised by the end result you will get. [spoiler]I will note that I personally liked the threeway ending the best, it felt like the true ending to it all considering how the girls had been “scheming” together over their shared crush for a long time already.[/spoiler]

review:
"Seiji es un niño MagTOW que quiere mas que nada en la vida alcanzar su gran meta de convertirse en astrónomo y estudiar el espacio, pero dos mujeres frienzoneadoras lo arrastran a la playa para pisotear sus ambiciones y atarlo a la mediocridad. ¿Podrá Seiji sobrevivir al verano como todo un alfa?"

Después de jugar Sakura Fantasy este se siente que ha caido mucho en calidad, todo es demasiado básico y hecho de prisa. La historia es básicamente el protagonista y sus dos amigas teniendo todo tipo se situaciones cliche en la playa y peleando por su amor. No hay voces, la interacción es casi nula y el numero de gráficos es mínimo (solo verás a las dos chicas y sus dos cambios de ropa para todo el juego), la música se vuelve molesta en poco tiempo. Lo único que me gustó son las ilustraciones sexys a pantalla completa de las chicas que son muy hermosas y aparecen varias a lo largo de la cortísima historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052683387', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1622731181}
review:
[h1]L’Edition Steam est l’édition complète, seule et unique, du jeu [/h1]
[u]Il n’existe pas[/u] quelque part en ligne un patch pour une éventuelle version "non-censurée"; Ainsi, le contenu ‘pour adulte’, est, dans ce titre, léger.
Quatrième jeu de l'éditeur "Winged Cloud" terminé à 100%, après un [i]Legend of Talia: Arcadia[/i] qui m’avais un peu laissé sur ma fin, troisième jeu du Sakura Bundle acheté sous grosses soldes, (que j’enchainerai dans l’ordre alphabétique) après un [i]Sakura Agent[/i] et un [i]Sakura Angels[/i] bien appréciés, voici ma première évaluation négative de cette longue liste de 31 "Winged Cloud" de ma bibliothèque, qui, pour 2,12€, est déjà trop cher selon moi, 9,99€… je ne ferais pas de commentaires sur le prix de base, le jeu est globalement bien noté.
Après les univers intéressants, sortants de la vie quotidiennes, écrites, et rythmé de mes premiers "jets" de cet éditeur, me voici être tombé sur un synopsis… propre au titre du jeu:
Trois étudiants amis d’enfances partent en vacances en hôtel en bord de plage pour une semaine, et enchaînent des journées plages.
Fil rouge de l’histoire? Les filles se disputant la recette de la sauce pour accompagner le poisson dans la première partie du jeu? Puis jouant les allumeuses et les prudes devant "the fool", "the silly", "the stupid" portant parfaitement bien son surnom et obligé de prétendre à chaque fois qu’il n’a aucune arrière-pensée devant leur comportement très clair?
Le tout avec deux ‘oups j’ai ouvert la porte sans toquer alors que tu portais seulement ce même maillot dans lequel je te vois toute la journée’, deux ‘oups j’ai accidentellement fait tombé mon haut de maillot de bain’, ‘vas-y qu’on mange une glace cylindrique de façon explicite en en faisant couler sur nos seins’, ‘oh tu peux m’aider à mettre de la crème dans mon dos "zut j’en ai fait couler au niveau de ses fesses, tant-pis je dois essuyer"’, ‘ça te dis un roullage de pelle à trois? C’est plus amusant qu’à deux…’, etc… pour rester dans le thème de ce type de jeu.
Visuellement des décors désertiques plutôt variés (y compris sur la plage que le texte suggère de ‘bondée’ et dans l’hôtel), deux uniques postures très similaires l’une de l’autre pour les deux uniques personnages affichés à l’écran tout le long du jeu, des textes bateau de conversations entre ‘amis’ avec texte à rallonge interminables pour rallonger la durée de vie, vide, accompagné d’une très faible variété d’expressions faciales, mais répondant au final seulement à l’absence de nécessiter de faire plus selon ce qu’est écrit dans le texte paresseux, saupoudré de musiques plates, répétitives, voir désagréables, à égal des différentes ‘péripéties’ épuisantes à lire et interminables dans leur meublage, l’autre "idiot" qui ne comprend rien, les filles jouant les boderlines (et inintéressantes), bref, jeu de séduction ridicule et cauchemardesque étalé sur une semaine alors que la situation finale du jeu aurait dû s’effectuer tôt pour ensuite démarrer l’histoire. Là on a juste une immense intro filant du point A au point B sans aucune surprise sinon la lenteur.
[u]Banalisation de la pollution des océans et du gaspillage de nourriture[/u] par le jet sans honte dans l’eau d’un sac de sauces et différentes épices sous emballages, nocifs pour la faune et la flore marine, réplique avec un sous-entendu TRES [u]homophobe[/u] lors d’un french-kiss entre filles, banalisation outrancière de l’[u]agression et du harcèlement sexuelle[/u] à plusieurs moments du jeu, avec une morale qui donne à peu près ceci: avoir la tête dans les longues études et rêver du ciel c’est mal, mieux vaut penser au nichons des filles (même pas explicites dans ce titre) et essayer de se taper ses deux copines d’enfances dans une relation à trois, après tous les lois rendant la polygamie illégale sont stupides.
[b]Durée de vied’un peu plus de 4h[/b] en lisant vite et dans les grandes lignes et en s’attardant sur quelques screens…. pour la première partie…… [b]plus une petite demie heure supplémentaire[/b] pour effectuer d’autres choix et ainsi obtenir le 100% en prenant en lisant cette fois si en diagonale les dialogues qui diffèrent mais en skipant tout l’identique.
Car oui, [i]le jeu propose une demi-douzaine de choix d’actions ou de dialogues qui définiront avec qui on termine (l’une, l’autre, les deux)[/i] avec presque rien d’alternatif, sinon un copié collé mais avec le/les bon(s) perso(s) à l’écran et le(s) prénom(s) allant avec, et images de la galerie qui suivent, avec, pour rappelle, l’absence totale de succès à obtenir pour tenir les éventuels joueurs épuisés en haleine.
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1500526351][u]Trois combinaisons (trois parties) minimum[/u][/url] pour obtenir le 100% de ‘la gallery’ données dans le lien si haut.
Pour ma part 4h30 de purge pour ce titre auraient due suffire, mais vous connaissez la meilleure? Le jeu suivant de la liste, que j’ai acheté dans ce fameux ‘Sakura Bundle’, n’est autre que [i]Sakura Beach 2[/i], semblant à première vue être la suite directe avec les mêmes persos (et une invitée bonus pour un total non pas de trois mais de quatre fins alternatives!)
Et ce foutu jeu, et bien je vais le lancer… et me le taper de A à Z !
L’être humain est une créature étrange...
Avec un peu de chance le premier opus n’était que la mise en place d’une histoire palpitante où soudainement des reptiliens zombies nazis vont sortir de l’eau pour attaquer tout le monde, ou des aliens débarqueront, ou même une sorcière changeant l’été en hivers glacial suffirait… mais ça ne sera pas le cas.

[b]Hautement non recommandé[/b], ou lorsque soldé si vous cherchez un petit cadeau pourri à offrir à un pote puceau pour son anniv’ ou son Nöel…

author: {'steamid': '76561198125580541', 'num_games_owned': 1206, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1615546554}
review:
К сожалению эти две части "Sakura Beach" мне не понравились ...... 
Две девушки борются за мечтательного парня , который постоянно думает о космосе 
И все две серии меня ОЧЕНЬ бесила тупая чсв бл*дь "Аюми" ! Как же я ненавижу некоторых цундере , это просто ужас ! 
Да и ГГ тоже слабохарактерный как половая тряпка ! 

Типо ситуация: 
-Аюми , мне научить тебя плавать ? 
- Я не нуждаюсь в твоей помощи , идиот ! 
- Ну раз ты не хочешь .... 
- Ну раз ты настаиваешь , то я согласна , идиот ! 
10 идиотов из 10 нах*й 

Жутко горело с этой тупой су*и !Именно эту новеллу я читал с большим трудом ! Дочитал я ее только из уважения к разработчику!Но мне не особо понравился Гг и Аюми ..... А когда тебя бесят 2 из 3 персонажей ...... то играть становиться сложно ! Читать было сложно даже не из за Аюми , а из за тупого паренька который даже не имеет своего мнение и действительно ведет себя как тряпка ! Давайте рассмотрим все более подробнее ! 
Начну пожалуй с минусом , так-как их намного больше ! 

Из минусов : 
- В игре есть тупая чсв бл*дь Аюми 
- Гг жутко тупой !!!!! 
- А женские персонажи в некоторых моментах не умнее Гг 
( Он заходит в комнату и видит ее в нижнем белье , за что она ломает ему еб*ло ! И через минуту она выходит в еще более 
откровенном купальнике чем было ее белье ) Что у японцев за тупые стереотипы с бельем ?????? 
Уже 8 лет смотрю аниме и играю в новеллы и не могу этого понять ..... 
- Есть много тупых моментов 
( на подобии когда Момоко чуть не пробила подушкой стену или когда она оглушила ГГ ебу*чей подушкой ! ПОДУШКОЙ!!!! 
Ну вы только вообще задумайтесь !!! Как подушкой можно оглушить человека ??? 
- Нету DLC 18 + 
- Мне не очень нравятся аниме/новеллы в жанре "дразнилка" где есть голые сиськи но нету сосков 
( почему-бы не добавить какой-то патч 18+ ???? ) 
- За свою цену первая часть ОЧЕНЬ халтурная ! 

Из плюсов : 
+ Красивая рисовка 
+ Большие сиськи 
+ Красивые аниме жопки 
+ Милые юри-моменты 
+ Есть карточки 

Я не буду ставить негативный отзыв только из уважение к разработчику , ведь я понимаю что "Sakura Beach" является одной из его первых работ ! Но первую часть(эту) я однозначно рекомендую покупать только по скидке в 75% + !

author: {'steamid': '76561198357848728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1615327139}
review:
Guys... I tried. I really tried on this one. As someone who frequents Humble Bundle deals, I snagged a few of these "Sakura" games for a buck a while back and figured I'd give this one a try. Why not, right? I love visual novel games like Phoenix Wright! I love anime! Of course I love bikinis! It was like my own personal Triforce of the top things I'd put on my job resume. But no. Like finding out Santa Claus isn't real, or that the Lucky Charms mascot died years ago and they've just been using CG to recreate his likeness against his estate's wishes... Sakura Beach was nothing but disappointment.

I endured this game for just about three hours before throwing in the very dry towel, and the parts I was awake for left me feeling equal parts bored and angry. You "play" as space-case protagonist Seiji who's on a vacation with his two generic-anime-girl childhood friends, Ayumi and Momoko. One is the openly flirty and fun-loving one, and the other is the tsundere who doesn't like you or anything! Baka! Tune in to see what kooky antics these two opposites get into this week! I used the word "play" loosely because those three hours I mentioned were nothing but clicking through dialogue and making exactly three choices in response to the girls' questions. What were those responses for? I'm assuming they're to hook up with the girl you wooed more in the end while the other becomes a volcano sacrifice or something. That's just my headcanon though. Truthfully I have no idea and felt Googling it was just adding unnecessary wear and tear to my keyboard.

So right... story... Seiji likes to daydream while his two attractive, bikini-clad friends make obvious passes at him. But he's not interested in them, he just wants to explore space, presumably to also ignore alien bikini girls. He walks in on them changing and they get upset, despite being half naked through the rest of the game. They talk about random nonsense to pad out the length. They put him in awkward situations like asking him to rub lotion on their backs... Just a lot of will-they, won't-they situations like this over and over. Then, while the game Phineas and Ferbs you with these repeat scenarios, you get to look at the same static backgrounds and character poses the entire time.

Sakura Beach tries to draw in its unwitting victims under the guise of a charming visual novel with some sexy elements to it. But aside from some admittedly well-done art depicting the girls in suggestive situations, the rest of the game feels like a punishment for you even considering to look at such filth. It's cheap, bland, boring, and I've been more aroused stepping on a thumbtack. I'm not asking for Persona levels of storytelling here, but for people like me who go into these types of games for the narrative first and foremost, it's disappointing to see the main draw of a game fail entirely on all fronts.

But hey... at least my boredom spared Ayumi her terrible volcanic fate! Momoko best girl 11/10!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198861917660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1613364457}
review:
3/10

This game was not good. 

Everything about this game was pretty bad except the art. The music isn't catchy and it gets extremely repetitive, the story is bland AF (most boring s*** ever), there's no actual nudity - sorry to the 99 percent of people who bought this but you wont be getting your rocks on for this. Game-play wise the developers actually tried to place a choice element into the game, but it only comes up less than 5 times and I doubt the choices actually make anything interesting; they should have just avoided the choice aspect all together and focus on the piss-poor story. To add to that the girls are both total jerks who act like the stereotypical girls found in romance films - saying s*** like "you're supposed to know my feelings" while they completely shut down your characters dreams, like wtf. Weirdest of all, there's a sexual harassment scene where one of the girls is exploited by the other, and its not sexy (at least to a normal person) because the girl being touched is telling the other to stop and asks your character to help (which he doesn't). Honestly I've never felt like I wasted my times trying to play a videogame until now; The last few minutes were excruciatingly painful.

If you want an intriguing visual novel get DOKI DOKI LITERATURE CLUB and if you want a good porn game with game-play aspects get Hunie - Pop. Just don't get this game, especially for 9.99 USD. 

smh . . .

review:
Very exquisite game with appeal in both plot and visual categories. I cannot recommend buying this game off sale given the relatively short playtime but it does go on sale very often and is a wonderful buy then.

The characters are both unique and interesting and never fail to have comedic and lewd moments with them. However, due to the slightly short length of the game, the ending can feel a bit rushed to some players of the game.

Played this with my mother to get her opinion on it. I'm gonna need money to afford an apartment now as I am currently getting kicked out of my current residence because of this game. Sakura Beach is a masterpiece that has never failed to impress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198999130766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1610668944}
review:
Its funny for the memes, but for real this shit is boring. This is not like other visual novel games. Its actually the most boring game you will ever play in your life. 

Dont be afraid to skip most of the dialogue, it has nothing to do with the actual plot, more so of just spitting nonsense. 
You get 6 options to pick from which don't effect the story. There are no wack situations like other visual novel games. Its a book basically. You should read a good book over this shit. Btw there's only 1 ending. And its terrible lmao

Like I said, I shouldnt be taking this game seriously, but for $10 please don't even consider this. Its so insanely boring. Btw I did not spend $10, im not THAT HORNY

author: {'steamid': '76561198043135631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2248, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1505575428}
review:
Two birds with one stone: That is this review.
Sakura Beach and the sequel Sakura Beach 2.
Both do have pretty much the same premise.
And so: I'm reviewing both at the same time.
Winged Cloud is releasing games frequently.
And sure, some of them are quite enjoyable.
But most of them are kind of pointless, tho.
I've played quite a lot of good visual novels.
Sakura Beach simply isn't a good one at all.
The story is extremely generic and blatant.
Even the characters really seem so generic.
It's like playing through a fan-fiction novel.
Why does it have positive reviews? Simple.
There are girls with boobs and that is that.
It's the only reason of the positive reviews.
But: I have seen much better ''fap'' games.
If this is supposed to be one: It is just bad.
And for 10€? That is simply a huge ripoff.
You can find better stuff for a lower price.
I absolutely do not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213554468', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 12282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12282, 'last_played': 1609927623}
review:
Шедевр в своём жанре.

Плюсы:
● Глубокий и проработанный сюжет, который заставляет задуматься о многом, и изменить свой взгляд на жизнь.
● Отличные персонажи с богатым и интересным бэкграундом. (Дизайн персонажей так же хорош).
● Превосходный саундтрек в жанре «Джаз».
● Лучше чем Ведьмак 3.

Минусы:
● Игра слишком короткая, максимум на часов 200 от силы.

Жаль что я ненавижу аниме̷̨̢̢̢̧̡̛̛̛̥͔͉͔̮̠̥͇̼̭͉̼̰͕̯͙̯̘͖͎̘̘͈͙̝̱͕̟̘̦̣͉̲̫̤͎̹̪̬̤̹͎͙̭̝̭̣͖̮͔̮͔̮͙̭̼̗͔̹͈̝̩̱͚̝̜̝̠̜̣̜̻̱͉͈̮̲̼͓̳͖̝͕̥̜̞̥͉̙͍̂̍̿̂͌̇̇̉̔͊͗̉̊͛͂͊͛͊̇̔̊̂̓̓̄̀͆͆̀͐̓͆̂̿̓̀̂̅̌̌́̒̎͐͂̑̓͑̎̉͛̋́̔͌̑̓̄̒̽̀̽̎̐̐͋̉̑̈́͂͛͊̅̇͐͑̓́̅̿͐͌̌͂̕͘͘̕̕͘͘͜͜͜͠͝͝͠͠ͅͅͅ


Итог: 9 из 10 — На любителя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303645854', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1609331390}
review:
This review will be a bit different from my other ones, I will be talking about this game in depth. So if you want a review like any of my other ones, here:
hot sex fucking
With that out of the way I warn that you should save this review and come back to it after you’ve completed the game, or if you don’t care about spoilers keep reading.

I found this game through a YouTube video made by jschlatt uploaded on his second channel jschlattLIVE called “csgo moments that will save the environment”, as I’m sure a lot of people did. I thought it would be pretty funny to buy the game, so I added it to my wishlist, waited for a sale and on the 27th of December 2020, I bought the game for 3.62 Australian dollars. And little did I know, I found one of my new favourite games of all time.

After recently finishing my 10th playthrough of Sakura Beach I now fully understand the game.

1, Background
Sakura Beach is a Visual Novel type game with erotic elements made by Winged Cloud studios and released on the 15th of August 2015, with Very Positive reviews on steam it is praised by critics and fans of the studio.

2. H-Scenes
To start I’ll just get this out of the way, yes the game has H-scenes but they are very softcore. But you shouldn’t play this game for those, you should play it for the development of the main characters and the very well made story.

3. Story
In Sakura Beach you play the role of a young man called Seiji going on a trip to the beach with his friends Ayumi and Momoko, over the course of the week you learn about Seiji’s problems at home and the backstory of this epic trio. I personally believe that Sakura Beach’s story is on par with literary masterpieces such as “Berserk”, “Persona 4” and “The Lord of The Rings” series’.

4. Characters: Overview
Sakura Beach hosts 3 main characters: Seiji, Ayumi and Momoko. While only having 2 side characters “Old Man” and “Old Woman” who only appear in 1 scene and comment on two of the characters’ relationship. At the end of the game depending on your choices either of the girls or both will confess their love for you causing Seiji to always reciprocate the same way, this mean there are 3 endings and one includes Seiji getting both girls.

4.1 Characters: Seiji
Seiji is a 16 year old high school boy who is very kind and shy towards the people around him, though we do not see his face he is very well implemented as a main character, over the course of the game we find out that his mother left him at a very young age and so he developed serious abandonment issues that he was able to overcome with the help of his grandfather and his friends Ayumi and Momoko. He lived with his grandfather until a year before the game’s narrative begins. During the mid point of the story we learn that he received a letter from his mother stating that she would like to see him, this causes him to shut himself in and start isolating from his friends which we later learn is the reason he and the others went on the beach trip that kicks off the start of the story. Nearing the end of the game he is forced to tell Ayumi and Momoko why he has been pushing them away which strengthens his resolve and ends his character arc.

4.2 Characters: Ayumi
Ayumi is a 15 year old high school girl who acts as one of the main love interests for Seiji, and is also featured in all the promotional material for Sakura Beach. She is the perfect example of the tsundere, who also has a short temper and is always calling people out for their shenanigans. She has been asked out by many boys at school but has denied them all because of her love for the main character. Ayumi has long black hair that she ties back and red eyes with pale skin. She and Seiji have been childhood friends since a forest trip when they were young, she also happened to live next to him until he moved out of his old house a year before the start of the story.

4.3 Characters: Momoko
Momoko is the third and final main character of Sakura Beach who acts as a secondary love interest for the main character. She has very long blonde hair and blue eyes with light skin. Momoko is somewhat of a bimbo who, similarly to Ayumi, is frequently asked out at school but has rejected all offers because she is also in love with Seiji. Momoko often teases Seiji and Ayumi, seemingly to no end.

5. Conclusion
Sakura Beach is a very well made Visual Novel with a god-tier story and amazing characters, by the time this review is posted I would have finished my 12th playthrough of this game. I recommend it as a Must-Play for any PC Gamer, well worth the full offering price of $15. I know my reviews are not usually this long but I felt that I needed to talk about this game in-depth to truly convey the greatness of it. I left out a fair bit of information and I could go way more in-depth, but I really just don’t feel like it.

An easy 10/10 and i will most likely replay it as soon as i finish it.

review: This game is pretty good compared to some of the other entries in this series. I appreciate how there is no straight r18 content. It is quite refreshing after sakura space, which I hated. The game honestly interested me up until the girls randomly started making out. I was ripped out of the immersion and very disappointed. Eventually they finally resolved the main conflict however it took much too long to get there and there was way too much build up when it could have ended much better without the sudden change of character in momoko and ayumi both. However, the CGs in this game are pretty good. Overall I like this one, but It's not at ALL without its problems.

review:
Sakura Beach is a great Romance Visual Novel from Winged Cloud.
We impersonate a boy who has his 2 girl friend from childhood time and is doing vacation on the beach. 2 girls are using a scheme to get him to move out of his closed in posture and try to make him do something with the provocative playing of the 2 girls.
In the end the story comes out a rather funny in some part there is quite the edgy scenes to see but the game has no sexual content.Nonetheless it is a really enjoyable romance featuring different routes and endings and also a beautiful art style.
I can only recommend it.

review:
I bought this game for around $2.50 CAD, overall I'd say if you're interested in an actual story, there's something here to be enjoyed. There isn't actually "nudity" in this game per say, rather close to. Unless you're 12 or 67 years old and consider nudity a female showing some skin, this game is safe enough. The mature tag is fitting, as there are suggestive topics and writings as well as images. 

Overall, 6/10, tags are a little misleading. If you have the money to drop on both games and you're interested. Go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171893998', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6000, 'last_played': 1605123242}
review:
Before I start this review I’d just like to say that this is by far one of the best games I’ve ever played.

Firstly I’d like to just have a little synopsis of the main story, it all starts off with the main character Seiji (you) on holiday with his two best friends named Ayumi and Momoko. The story follows the daily life on holiday but something isn’t quite right, Ayumi and Momoke seem a little off and this gets more prevalent throughout the game, it all concludes with one of the best endings in game history. The three endings all bring something to the table and all have their own appeals.

The first thing I’d like to take a look at is the story telling. I believe that the storytelling is quite masterful in this game, it has a way of ensnaring you in it, and playing around with you. The story starts off like your average story would with a bit of an introduction to the characters but that’s not what makes the story really shine, the story really starts to shine after the introductions in the way that it starts alluding more and more to the fact that Ayumi and Momoko have something urgent to tell you, something that they just can’t keep in any longer. Not only does the game have this sort of build up to the end, but it also has another main part of it’s story, and that is Ayumi and Momokos wish to see more of you, than you let out. These two things together are very powerful and strike you right where it wants.

Another important but overlooked part of this game is its music. The music of this game really has a way of entrancing you in it, and it really brings all of the story elements together with its calming yet upbeat nature, the music also shifts at some points notably when the main character is put in a precarious situation with the girls like rubbing sunscreen on their backs when these moments occur the music shifts to this more dreamlike songs with a way of making you feel what the character is feeling. I vividly remember the music during the confession, it brought a tear to my eye.

The last key part of this game would have to be the characters so let me give you a bit of a rundown. The main character named Seiji is a boy in his teens, he’s a man who frequently daydreams of the universe and holds it very dear to him, he’s quite a lonely kid with his only friends being Ayumi and Momoko and his only current parent being his father after his mother left his dad and him to themselves, on this holiday Seiji really tries to find his existence like he’s done so many times before, forgetting that his friends are by his side. Another one of the three characters in this game is Momoko a blonde girl with blue eyes and big tits, she’s a happy and energetic girl that’s also quite smart, and a very caring and nice person she’s a bit naive and carefree at times though, but in the end it’s her happy and caring nature that shows. And the last character (and my personal favourite) is Ayumi, Ayumi is a black haired in a sidey ponytail she also has red eyes, Ayumi is what you’d describe as a textbook tsundere with a bit of a hot temper which is reflected in her red eye colour, she also frequently accuses Seiji of being a pervert and at some points she’s also a bit sarcastic, yet at heart she’s a nice and positive person, the only reason for her acting this way is her insecurities and crush on Seiji. All in all the cast may not be packed with many characters but that’s not the point of it, the story wouldn’t work with a jam packed cast, and the story is perfect with what it has.

Now for the conclusion. I believe that Sakura Beach is one of the best games of the century completely standing in its own. It is a masterpiece in the dating game genre, it really has a way of standing its own against other giants and is by far the best game in the genre if you ask me. 10/10 would play 100 hours more.

review: Quite a well established game with many laughs and a story that kept me on the edge of my seat. The auto feature really adds a new dynamic to the game allowing for you to sit back and relax while watching the ageless story.  The artwork is on another level, being the anime junky that I am I am proud to say this is one of the most well polished pieces of art I have ever laid my eyes upon. My only true complaint is the sound being so loud, but some chill lofi beats did the job splendidly.  I simply could not have asked for a better Christmas present in a million years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811914094', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1600153100}
review: Sakura Beach é um visual novel como qualquer outro, onde é contada uma história e a única opção do jogador é escolher em alguns momentos o que seu personagem deve dizer ou fazer. Para mim é difícil fazer uma análise de um "jogo" assim, uma vez que na minha opinião um jogo deve possuir alguns aspectos básicos (controlar personagem, puzzles, exploração, pular, andar, etc) e não apenas apertar um botão e ver o que acontece. Não estou dizendo que o jogo é ruim, afinal ele possui uma boa música, bom desenho de personagens e uma boa história. Logo, recomendo este "jogo" basicamente para amantes do gênero. Nada contra, só que para mim não é muita diversão. Nota 5/10. Recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109972290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1599323786}
review:
-3 hours of my life, this plot of the game is too stupid and boring for me. 80-90% of a very boring conversation, 10-20% is really interesting and exciting. Seiji, the main character, was too stupid and disgusted to read what he said and thought. Ayumi is too aggressive and I don't like the way she communicates and reacts to everything. Momoko was the only one I liked. 
When i played i really wanted this to end faster.

I liked the drawing, it is beautiful and the girls are very beautiful, but there are few drawings.

I'm sorry that I spent so much money on it, but mostly I did it for screenshots.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198866662827', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1595764009}
review:
Sakura Beach, a short and simple visual novel, one to bring a smile to your face.
Now that the intro is out of the way, I'll go over the good points and the not so good points.

The Characters are wonderfully done, each with their own believable personalities. There are short comings in each of them, yes that is to be expected.
The art style is another aspect you can enjoy about it, it has a professional feel yet it has an armature sort of charm which I cannot really describe. 
The music is rather good, although when it comes to the looping of the song it fades out only to jump back in as if that never happened. It is rather off putting sometimes, although bearable.

Now onto the negatives,
I wanna love the scenes to bits, I do, but when you put them in each attempted route, you find the player using the skip function, skipping through them again.
Another thing, there is no history key or button so if you say accidentally miss a line of text. You're forced to load a save or keep going, It's rather annoying with a trigger finger like mine. It's more of a pet peeve than anything else.
There is little to no variation between each route, only the ending, even then it pretty much feels the same when you look at them at the same time.

Despite I got this game for free, and I did enjoy my 5 or so hours of playing it, I must personally say if you're getting it on sale and you got some time to kill, go for it. If you're buying it for the sexual content, I'd take a hard pass as all you're gonna get is swimsuits and other beach things. It's more risky content than hentai.


I'd rate it a solid, 7.1 out of 10. Could be far better, but I would still simp again for another thing like this.

But what do I really know? I'm just a British guy with a keyboard and an opinion.

review:
The Sakura series is best described as a series of lewd anime visual novels 
This one leans more into "novel" than "lewd" 
This one feels like it has lewd scenes b/c they need to meet their lewd scene quota between story bits. Some of their other games feel the opposite. 

TLDR: More romance-ey, less hentai-ey than your average Sakura game. One of my favourites.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970498444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1595501014}
review:
I thought I'd give a visual novel a shot. Went with this one because it was on sale and has good reviews.

I couldn't even make it a full hour. I found the characters annoying, especially the POV character, who was dense to the point of absurdity. The game's attempts at humor didn't hit the mark for me, and the "story" was incredibly dull. It's like playing a boring porn minus the porn. In fact, there isn't even any nudity, despite the "Nudity" tag. I'm not sure who this game is for, but it's not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132100663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1597627097}
review: At first, I had bought this game as a meme, a joke in a sense. But as I started playing it, I came to realize the absolute masterpiece this game is, the captivating writing allowing detailed imagery as you play, a great interface, phenomenal character development. This game sells initially on the more lewd sexual side to it, but absolutely gives you much more than you bargained for. As you are playing this game, you can feel how the characters would in their situation. This game has a sad undertone, with funny, embarrassing, deep, and beautiful moments. I honestly had somewhat high hopes for this game, hoping that it would deliver storytelling well, but i got a lionshare more than I asked for. This game slowly shows more of a deep understanding of the concept of love, and deviates from a mere sexual need as the story progresses. At moments I truly felt sad, and in those moments of sadness I was scared that things wouldn't be left off well, but I have been more than surprised with this game. It is well worth the money and I would highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333633493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1697263773}
review:
I, as a gaming connoisseur, think I have just found the greatest game of all time. Yes ladies and gentlemen, after 1,318 hours of playing I have decided this is the perfect game. It hurt me to dethrone Super Monkey Ball 2 from it's position of number 1 on my Top Sextillion Games of All Time List, but I will not regret it. This game has changed me in so many ways: physically, mentally, maybe even sexually. It might've even opened my third eye. It takes a owning a brain of a significantly large mass to understand this masterpiece of a game and it's amazing and nuanced characters (if you are wondering, I have a pretty large brain mass). Even with my giga brain, It took me years to finally understand the complex story of this work of art and I could say that I have become what some may call a "scholar of all things Sakura Beach". I could practically teach a class on the subject of this game. 

The characters featured in this masterclass of a game are probably some of the greatest characters in all of literature. They were so masterfully written that it almost felt like they were real people (even though I don't really know how a real person would act anymore because I haven't left my house in 20 years). Now, you may feel like the characters are one-note, anime stereotypes, but you're just ignorant of how amazingly written they are. You probably have a brain the size of a peanut if you can't see how dynamic the characters are. Yes, I will admit, I might've had a few incidents where I was what you monkey-brains would call "aroused", but it in no way hurt my gaming experience.

And don't even get me started on the soundtrack. Being a famous world-class piano soloist, I thought nobody could surpass me in musical ability. Oh, was I wrong. The soundtrack was the greatest thing that has ever reached my ears. The soundtrack is quite possibly better than the works of Mozart, Bach, Beethoven, and Kanye West combined (and if you say otherwise you're just wrong). 

In conclusion, this game sucks dick: 4/10. Would've been better if there was giant robots or some shit. Have a nice day.

review:
The two female leads, Ayumi and Momoko are abusive tsundere types who physically and emotionally abuse Seiji - he lets them get away with it because they are both cute girls. On several occasions, Seiji is struck so hard by the one of the girls that he actually loses consciousness and is left with a concussion yet neither girl ever apologises or brings attention to his injuries.

The revelation that the two girls are actually in a lesbian relationship and have only been teasing Seiji the whole time was just painful.

 I guess this is supposed to be funny but I just find it uncomfortable to read and I fear that if he ended up in a relationship with either of them he would become miserable and henpecked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277169803', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1628294616}
review:
A good game if you are looking for a cute story to mindlessly pass time, if jerking off is your intention this isnt exactly the game for you.  The characters are a bit cliche but the dialog is funny enough to not make you think about that too much, the english translation is also a bit wierd but i think it adds to the humour.
In conclusion: Good story, nice art, decent music (lacks a bit variety) overall 7.2/10, maybe a bit overpriced when not in sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003786902', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1591582053}
review:
Before we get into it; This game doesn't have much ecchi let alone any H-scenes.

The writing for this one was bad. Scenes were kinda boring, there was at least one spelling error that I noticed. And both heroines were hella annoying. They used the same basic template as Sakura Angel of one airhead and one tsundere but neither of these girls have any redeeming characteristics. 

Back to MIDI files was jaring after Sakura Fantasy, these were also worse than normal as they looped poorly. At least one was re-used from previous games.

The character art was the only thing that seemed like it improved. Or maybe they just had a different artist.

This one is the first Sakura game to have a follow up, but given how much I disliked this title I'm not sure I'm going to go straight into it. So much beach potential wasted, maybe itll be reached in the sequel.

One last complaint, But this is about the series overall.
Can you please stop using the SAME *walking in on someone changing clothes* trope in every.god.damn.game. use some creativity ffs

author: {'steamid': '76561198846387491', 'num_games_owned': 1088, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1587327578}
review:
Sakura Beach is one of the early Visual Novels from the mass producer Winged Cloud.
It is a short, romantic slice of life with a love triangle. 

The story itself is nothing special but not the worst I've seen. Not much is happening, but since it's short, it's bearable. There are some choices which influence your ending, but there is little difference between them so it's still very linear (like kinetic novel).
The character sprites are nice and so are the backgrounds.
The music fits the events but is rather forgettable. One thing I found grating was the way it loops. It is not fluid, discreet loop but a 'jumpy' one. It's not a big but certainly noticeable 'feature'.
There is a standard unlockable gallery in extras, but getting all CGs poses no challenge even without a guide.

Overall, it's an average VN with a an unremarkable story, decent art and ok music. 5/10 at best imo.
